synopsis: Suzuki Sora’s dream comes true when she is selected to attend magic school in Tokyo. Though she will miss her friends and the countryside, she must fulfill the promise to become a licensed mage.
Sora has an eventful first day in Tokyo. The long journey from Biei proves to be exhausting.
Suzuki Sora’s first magic client assignment doesn’t go as planned, but teaches her that there just might be more to life  than magic.
Sora’s housemate Gota Midorikawa would rather be surfing than learning more about his mage lineage. In addition, his first magic client proves to be challenge his skills and patience.
Sora is learning the hard way that magic can bring about miracles, but also misery. Sometimes the effects of her magic actions will have repercussions.

Sora’s getting used to odd requests for magic action, but the request for a baby is certainly a new one. She and her classmates are faced with the challenge to use magic outside of an official request.
Sora and Gota’s fellow classmate faces a challenging magic clients and struggles with his commitment to magic school.
City Hall requests assistance from the magic school trainees.
A trip to the beach proves to be magical for Sora and Gota.
Some things can't be fixed by magic.
The trainees realize exactly what they have accomplished in their short time together.
The freedom from school separates the trainees as Sora returns to her mother and dog in the countryside.
